newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: New Zealand dollar ends higher, seen range-trading.
newsitem.headline: New Zealand dollar ends higher, seen range-trading.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar hitched a ride with the Australian currency to close higher on Wednesday, and dealers said it looked content to range trade for the time being.
S&P said they had put Australia on creditwatch positive after Tuesday's budget.
"Pretty much tracking closely the Aussie," one dealer said of the Kiwi. "Aussie made a reasonable recovery, testing the 70 cent (U.S.) area, and with that Kiwi has been able to chug on up," he said.
The Kiwi closed at US$0.6902/09, up from its 0.6894/01 open. However, at 65.44 the Kiwi was a touch weaker on its Trade-Weighted Index, having opened at 65.48.
"The Kiwi has been lacking a bit of its own momentum just lately. There's obviously been a lot of interest rate buying over the last week, and that's kept us in a healthy tone," one dealer said.
"We're just sort of ranging before we find out which way Aussie's going." The Australian currency closed at US$0.7897/02.
Dealers expected the Kiwi to trade a 0.6890-6920 range overnight.
